chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
TraverseVarInjective

Premises:
TraverseVarInjective_my_value_my_value = {| traverse_var_injective := traverse_my_value_injective |} : TraverseVarInjective
Record TraverseVarInjective (V : Type) (H : Var V) (T : Type) (H0 : Traverse V T) : Prop := Build_TraverseVarInjective { traverse_var_injective : forall f : nat -> nat -> nat, (forall x1 x2 l : nat, f l x1 = f l x2 -> x1 = x2) -> forall (t1 t2 : T) (l : nat), traverse_var f l t1 = traverse_var f l t2 -> t1 = t2 } Arguments TraverseVarInjective {V}%type_scope {H} {T}%type_scope {H0} Arguments Build_TraverseVarInjective [V]%type_scope _ [T]%type_scope _ _%function_scope
Build_TraverseVarInjective : forall (V : Type) (H : Var V) (T : Type) (H0 : Traverse V T), (forall f : nat -> nat -> nat, (forall x1 x2 l : nat, f l x1 = f l x2 -> x1 = x2) -> forall (t1 t2 : T) (l : nat), traverse_var f l t1 = traverse_var f l t2 -> t1 = t2) -> TraverseVarInjective
LiftInjective_Traverse = fun (V : Type) (H : Var V) (T : Type) (H0 : Traverse V T) (H1 : TraverseVarInjective) => {| lift_injective := fun (w k : nat) (t1 t2 : T) (H2 : traverse (fun l x : nat => var (lift w (l + k) x)) 0 t1 = traverse (fun l x : nat => var (lift w (l + k) x)) 0 t2) => traverse_var_injective (fun l x : nat => lift w (l + k) x) (fun (x1 x2 l : nat) (H3 : lift w (l + k) x1 = lift w (l + k) x2) => lift_injective w (l + k) x1 x2 H3) t1 t2 0 H2 |} : forall (V : Type) (H : Var V) (T : Type) (H0 : Traverse V T), TraverseVarInjective -> LiftInjective...
ssrbool.PredOfSimpl.coerce : forall T : Type, ssrbool.simpl_pred T -> ssrbool.pred T
BinIntDef.Z.sub = fun m n : BinNums.Z => BinIntDef.Z.add m (BinIntDef.Z.opp n) : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.sub (_ _)%Z_scope
BinNat.N.mul_comm : forall n m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.mul n m = BinNat.N.mul m n
Ring_theory.IDphi : forall R : Type, R -> R
traverse_my_value_injective : forall f : nat -> nat -> nat, (forall x1 x2 l : nat, f l x1 = f l x2 -> x1 = x2) -> forall (t1 t2 : my_value) (l : nat), traverse_var f l t1 = traverse_var f l t2 -> t1 = t2
BinIntDef.Z.opp = fun x : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos x0 => BinNums.Zneg x0 | BinNums.Zneg x0 => BinNums.Zpos x0 end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.opp _%Z_scope
Inductive N : Set := N0 : BinNums.N | Npos : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNums.Npos _%positive_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive CompareSpec (Peq Plt Pgt : Prop) : comparison -> Prop := CompEq : Peq -> CompareSpec Peq Plt Pgt Eq | CompLt : Plt -> CompareSpec Peq Plt Pgt Lt | CompGt : Pgt -> CompareSpec Peq Plt Pgt Gt Arguments CompareSpec (_ _ _)%type_scope Arguments CompEq [Peq]%type_scope (_ _)%type_scope Arguments CompLt _%type_scope [Plt]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments CompGt (_ _)%type_scope [Pgt]%type_scope
Ring_polynom.P1 : forall C : Type, C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
BinNat.N.shiftr_spec' : forall a n m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.testbit (BinNat.N.shiftr a n) m = BinNat.N.testbit a (BinNat.N.add m n)
Ring_theory.morph1 : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> req (phi cI) rI
BinInt.Z.succ_wd = Morphisms.reflexive_proper BinInt.Z.succ : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful BinInt.Z.eq BinInt.Z.eq) BinInt.Z.succ
BinInt.Z.quot_add : forall a b c : BinNums.Z, c <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.mul (BinInt.Z.add a (BinInt.Z.mul b c)) a) -> BinInt.Z.quot (BinInt.Z.add a (BinInt.Z.mul b c)) c = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.quot a c) b
Ring_polynom.PEadd : forall C : Type, Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C
BinInt.Z.quot_rem : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> a = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul b (BinInt.Z.quot a b)) (BinInt.Z.rem a b)
Traverse_my_value_my_term = {| traverse := traverse_my_term |} : Traverse my_value my_term
BinInt.Z.add_wd = Morphisms.reflexive_proper BinInt.Z.add : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful BinInt.Z.eq (Morphisms.respectful BinInt.Z.eq BinInt.Z.eq)) BinInt.Z.add
BinNatDef.N.modulo = fun a b : BinNums.N => snd (BinNatDef.N.div_eucl a b) : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.modulo (_ _)%N_scope
ssrbool.pred_of_argType : forall T : ssrbool.predArgType, ssrbool.simpl_pred T
Ring_polynom.norm_subst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> nat -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
